channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Rise and Potential of Large Language Model Based Agents: A Survey
item.description: Many efforts have been made to develop intelligent agents, but they mainly focus on advancement in algorithms or training strategies to enhance specific capabilities or performance on particular tasks.

item.title: LongLoRA: Efficient Fine-tuning of Long-Context Large Language Models
item.description: LongLoRA adopts LLaMA2 7B from 4k context to 100k, or LLaMA2 70B to 32k on a single 8x A100 machine.

item.title: NExT-GPT: Any-to-Any Multimodal LLM
item.description: While recently Multimodal Large Language Models (MM-LLMs) have made exciting strides, they mostly fall prey to the limitation of only input-side multimodal understanding, without the ability to produce content in multiple modalities.

item.title: ProPainter: Improving Propagation and Transformer for Video Inpainting
item.description: We also propose a mask-guided sparse video Transformer, which achieves high efficiency by discarding unnecessary and redundant tokens.

item.title: Agents: An Open-source Framework for Autonomous Language Agents
item.description: Recent advances on large language models (LLMs) enable researchers and developers to build autonomous language agents that can automatically solve various tasks and interact with environments, humans, and other agents using natural language interfaces.

item.title: Kani: A Lightweight and Highly Hackable Framework for Building Language Model Applications
item.description: Language model applications are becoming increasingly popular and complex, often including features like tool usage and retrieval augmentation.

item.title: The Reversal Curse: LLMs trained on "A is B" fail to learn "B is A"
item.description: This shows a failure of logical deduction that we hypothesize is caused by the Reversal Curse.

item.title: DreamLLM: Synergistic Multimodal Comprehension and Creation
item.description: This paper presents DreamLLM, a learning framework that first achieves versatile Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) empowered with frequently overlooked synergy between multimodal comprehension and creation.

item.title: Communicative Agents for Software Development
item.description: At the core of this paradigm lies ChatDev, a virtual chat-powered software development company that mirrors the established waterfall model, meticulously dividing the development process into four distinct chronological stages: designing, coding, testing, and documenting.

item.title: AgentVerse: Facilitating Multi-Agent Collaboration and Exploring Emergent Behaviors in Agents
item.description: Autonomous agents empowered by Large Language Models (LLMs) have undergone significant improvements, enabling them to generalize across a broad spectrum of tasks.

item.title: Focused Transformer: Contrastive Training for Context Scaling
item.description: This novel approach enhances the structure of the (key, value) space, enabling an extension of the context length.

item.title: Baichuan 2: Open Large-scale Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance on a variety of natural language tasks based on just a few examples of natural language instructions, reducing the need for extensive feature engineering.

item.title: 3D Gaussian Splatting for Real-Time Radiance Field Rendering
item.description: Radiance Field methods have recently revolutionized novel-view synthesis of scenes captured with multiple photos or videos.

item.title: OmniQuant: Omnidirectionally Calibrated Quantization for Large Language Models
item.description: To tackle this issue, we introduce an Omnidirectionally calibrated Quantization (OmniQuant) technique for LLMs, which achieves good performance in diverse quantization settings while maintaining the computational efficiency of PTQ by efficiently optimizing various quantization parameters.

item.title: OverFlow: Putting flows on top of neural transducers for better TTS
item.description: Neural HMMs are a type of neural transducer recently proposed for sequence-to-sequence modelling in text-to-speech.

item.title: Code Llama: Open Foundation Models for Code
item.description: We release Code Llama, a family of large language models for code based on Llama 2 providing state-of-the-art performance among open models, infilling capabilities, support for large input contexts, and zero-shot instruction following ability for programming tasks.

item.title: Gold-YOLO: Efficient Object Detector via Gather-and-Distribute Mechanism
item.description: In the past years, YOLO-series models have emerged as the leading approaches in the area of real-time object detection.

item.title: EfficientViT: Lightweight Multi-Scale Attention for On-Device Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Unlike prior semantic segmentation models that rely on heavy self-attention, hardware-inefficient large-kernel convolution, or complicated topology structure to obtain good performances, our lightweight multi-scale attention achieves a global receptive field and multi-scale learning (two critical features for semantic segmentation models) with only lightweight and hardware-efficient operations.

item.title: GPT4Image: Can Large Pre-trained Models Help Vision Models on Perception Tasks?
item.description: We present a new learning paradigm in which the knowledge extracted from large pre-trained models are utilized to help models like CNN and ViT learn enhanced representations and achieve better performance.

item.title: AdaBin: Improving Binary Neural Networks with Adaptive Binary Sets
item.description: Since the modern deep neural networks are of sophisticated design with complex architecture for the accuracy reason, the diversity on distributions of weights and activations is very high.
